forcefw:tests:purge.description: All Apex test results will be purged in the chosen org.
examples:
Purge all Apex unit test results:
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %>

flags-dir.name: flags-dir
flags-dir.summary: Import flag values from a directory.

target-org.name: target-org
target-org.summary: Username or alias of the target org.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.summary: Setting this flag will produce output recording command's progress.

limit.name: limit
limit.summary: Sets the number of Apex test results to be purged. If unset, all results will be purged.

forcefw:tests:purge.summary: Removes all Apex test results from an org.

forcefw:tests:run.description:
The tests are first run in parallel. Any tests that fail to run due to a ROW LOCK error are re-run synchronously.
Once the re-run has completed, any tests that failed in both parallel and synchronously are reported.

flags-dir.name: flags-dir
flags-dir.summary: Import flag values from a directory.

target-org.name: target-org
target-org.summary: Username or alias of the target org.

output-file.name: output-file
output-file.summary: Output file for results. Filename extension determines data format used. Two formats are supported. For CSV use .csv. For JSON use .json

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.summary: Setting this flag will produce output recording command's progress.

forcefw:tests:run.summary: Runs all non-namespaced unit tests in an org.
